meanings.definition: Establishing control over a territory or people by settling there
meanings.sent1: The explorers were colonializing the new land by building settlements.
meanings.sent2: The British were colonializing India during the 19th century.
meanings.sent3: The settlers were colonializing the area so fast, they ran out of building materials!
meanings.sent4: The idea of colonializing Mars has been a topic of discussion among scientists.
meanings.sent5: The process of colonializing can have long-lasting effects on the local population.

meanings.definition: Imposing one's own culture and beliefs on a group of people
meanings.sent1: The missionaries were colonializing the indigenous tribe by introducing new customs.
meanings.sent2: The conquerors were colonializing the native population with their traditions.
meanings.sent3: The tourists jokingly accused their guide of colonializing them with his favorite food.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was colonializing the students' minds with her strong opinions.
meanings.sent5: The company was accused of colonializing the local market with their products.

meanings.definition: Exploiting resources and labor in a foreign land
meanings.sent1: The colonializing of natural resources led to environmental degradation.
meanings.sent2: The company's colonializing of cheap labor in the developing country sparked controversy.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon depicted a comical version of colonializing where the resources fought back.
meanings.sent4: The concept of colonializing labor was compared to modern-day outsourcing.
meanings.sent5: The history books highlighted the negative impacts of colonializing on indigenous populations.
